availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James F. Jenkins (Boyd County, KY, shoemaker and soldier)

body.p: Boyd County, Kentucky, shoemaker and soldier. Ohio native. Married to Rachel Jenkins. Father of Susan B. Jenkins, Rosalind D. Jenkins, Lydia E. Jenkins, and Joseph S. Jenkins. Shoemaker in Boyd County, Kentucky, in 1860. Served in the 91st Ohio Volunteer Infantry Regiment as a sergeant and private from August 1862 to June 24, 1865.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Boyd County, Catlettsburg, p. 799.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Ohio, Gallia County, Addison, p. 231A.
Registers of Veterans at National Homes for Disabled Volunteer Soldiers, 1866-1938, NARA RG 15, Microfilm Publication M1749, Records of the Veterans Administration, Roll 49, Central Branch, Dayton, OH, p. 16186.
Official Roster of the Soldiers of the State of Ohio in the War of the Rebellion, vol. 7, 1861-1866 (Cincinnati: The Ohio Valley Press, 1888), 129.
